maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet for retrieving data on a specific MX Appliance port in a Network
This cmdlet will retrieve an Object with configuration data on a specific MX appliance port

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will retrieve data on port 1 on the MX appliance in the network: $id

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet for retrieving all appliance ports from a specified network
This cmdlet will retrieve an object containing configuration data on all the ports on a MX appliance.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will retrieve information on all the ports on the MX appliance on the network $Id

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet for retrieving data on a specific client
Cmdlet which retrieves a PS Object with data on a specific client on a specific network
Network Id for the network which the client is associated with
Client Id of the client you want to retrieve data on

ApiKey for Meraki Dashboard. Check following Meraki Docs to see how to get a Dashboard API Key: https://documentation.meraki.com/General_Administration/Other_Topics/Cisco_Meraki_Dashboard_API#:~:text=For%20access%20to%20the%20API,to%20generate%20an%20API%20key.
Network Id for the network which the client is associated with
Client Id of the client you want to retrieve data on

ApiKey for Meraki Dashboard. Check following Meraki Docs to see how to get a Dashboard API Key: https://documentation.meraki.com/General_Administration/Other_Topics/Cisco_Meraki_Dashboard_API#:~:text=For%20access%20to%20the%20API,to%20generate%20an%20API%20key.

dev:type.maml:name: System.String[] - You can pipe the Id (network id) into the cmdlet
System.String[] - You can pipe the ClientId (Client Id) into the cmdlet
System.Object[] - This cmdlet will output a PS Object with data on the specific client defined.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This cmdlet will retrieve a PS Object on a specific client, defined by the -ClientId, on a specific Network defined by -Id

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet for retriving information on a specific Meraki device
Cmdlet which will retrieve a PS Object of information on a specific Meraki Device
The Serial number for a specific Cisco Meraki device.

ApiKey for Meraki Dashboard. Check following Meraki Docs to see how to get a Dashboard API Key: https://documentation.meraki.com/General_Administration/Other_Topics/Cisco_Meraki_Dashboard_API#:~:text=For%20access%20to%20the%20API,to%20generate%20an%20API%20key.
The Serial number for a specific Cisco Meraki device.

ApiKey for Meraki Dashboard. Check following Meraki Docs to see how to get a Dashboard API Key: https://documentation.meraki.com/General_Administration/Other_Topics/Cisco_Meraki_Dashboard_API#:~:text=For%20access%20to%20the%20API,to%20generate%20an%20API%20key.

dev:type.maml:name: System.String[] - You can pipe the Serial into the cmdlet
System.Object[] - This cmdlet will output a PS Object with data on the specific device.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will retrieve a PS Object of the device specified by the serial number provided in the parameter -Serial
This example will grap the serial through the pipeline and return an PS Object of the specified device.

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet for retrieving all clientes associated to a specific device
This cmdlet will retrieve all the clients which are or have been connected to a specific device
The Serial number for a specific Cisco Meraki device.

ApiKey for Meraki Dashboard. Check following Meraki Docs to see how to get a Dashboard API Key: https://documentation.meraki.com/General_Administration/Other_Topics/Cisco_Meraki_Dashboard_API#:~:text=For%20access%20to%20the%20API,to%20generate%20an%20API%20key.
The Serial number for a specific Cisco Meraki device.

ApiKey for Meraki Dashboard. Check following Meraki Docs to see how to get a Dashboard API Key: https://documentation.meraki.com/General_Administration/Other_Topics/Cisco_Meraki_Dashboard_API#:~:text=For%20access%20to%20the%20API,to%20generate%20an%20API%20key.

dev:type.maml:name: System.String[] - You can pipe the Serial into the cmdlet
System.Array - The cmdlet will output an PS Object with an array of all the clients associated to a specific device.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will return all the clients that are or have been connected, the last 24 hours, to a specific Cisco Meraki device.
This example will grap the serial fnumber from the pipeline and retrieve all the clients connected to the specific device.

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet for retrieving information on Device Management Interface
This cmdlet will return an Object containing configuration information on the Device Management interface of a specified device.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will retrive the configurations made for the Device Management interface on the device: QXLA-23BA-LS98

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet for retrieving a specified firewalled service from a network
This cmdlet will retrieve information on a specific firewalled service on a network. It will retrieve information such as Access policy, Allowed IPs.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will retrieve a PowerShell object containing configurations for the SNMP firewalled service on a specific network

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet for retrieving firewalled services from a specific network
This cmdlet will query a specified network and retrieve an object of firewalled service

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will retrieve a PowerShell object of all the firewalled services in a network

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet for retrieving all L3 firewall rules for a network
This cmdlet will return an Array of all L3 firewall rules configured on a network

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will return all L3 firewall rules configured for the network with Id L_918231134598135.

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet for retrieving all (meraki)devices on a network
Cmdlet which will retrieve a PS Object with an array of all the networks claimed and added to a specific network
Network Id from the network you want to retrive the devices from.

ApiKey for Meraki Dashboard. Check following Meraki Docs to see how to get a Dashboard API Key: https://documentation.meraki.com/General_Administration/Other_Topics/Cisco_Meraki_Dashboard_API#:~:text=For%20access%20to%20the%20API,to%20generate%20an%20API%20key.
Network Id from the network you want to retrive the devices from.

ApiKey for Meraki Dashboard. Check following Meraki Docs to see how to get a Dashboard API Key: https://documentation.meraki.com/General_Administration/Other_Topics/Cisco_Meraki_Dashboard_API#:~:text=For%20access%20to%20the%20API,to%20generate%20an%20API%20key.

dev:type.maml:name: System.String[] - You can pipe the Id(network id) into the cmdlet
System.Array[] - The cmdlet will output an PS Object with an array of all the devices on the network.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will retrive all the networks located on the network with the "<network_id>" you provided the in the parameter Id.
This example will grap the id of the network with name "Network1" through the pipeline and return all the (network)devices on that specific network.

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet for retrieving all networks in an Meraki Organisation.
This cmdlet will retrieve a powershell object with information on all the networks in your Meraki Organisation.
Organisation id of the specific organisation you want to see the devices from. If you have run Set-SCMrkAuth before running this cmdlet the parameter is not necessary.

ApiKey for Meraki Dashboard. Check following Meraki Docs to see how to get a Dashboard API Key: https://documentation.meraki.com/General_Administration/Other_Topics/Cisco_Meraki_Dashboard_API#:~:text=For%20access%20to%20the%20API,to%20generate%20an%20API%20key.
Organisation id of the specific organisation you want to see the devices from. If you have run Set-SCMrkAuth before running this cmdlet the parameter is not necessary.

ApiKey for Meraki Dashboard. Check following Meraki Docs to see how to get a Dashboard API Key: https://documentation.meraki.com/General_Administration/Other_Topics/Cisco_Meraki_Dashboard_API#:~:text=For%20access%20to%20the%20API,to%20generate%20an%20API%20key.

dev:type.maml:name: System.String[] - You can pipe OrgId as a string into the cmdlet.
System.Array[] - The cmdlet will output an PS Object with an array of all the networks.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will take an ApiKey and an Organisation Id and retrieve all networks in that organisation.
If you have already run Set-SCMrkAuth, then you will not need to provide any other parameters for retriving networks in that organisation you specified in Set-MrkAuth.

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet for retrieving SNMP configurations of a network
This cmdlet will query a specific network and output the SNMP configurations from it

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will retrieve the SNMP configurations from the network L_918231134598135

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet for retrieving all Network Vlans and Subnets.
Cmdlet which will retrieve an array of object containing each subnet or vlan configured on a Meraki network.

dev:type.maml:name: System.String[] - You can pipe the Id(network id) into the cmdlet
System.Array[] - The cmdlet will output an PSObject with an array of all the vlans

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will return an array of all the vlans configured on the network with Id L_918231134598135.
This example will pass the id of the network: TEST-NETWORK into the cmdlet Get-SCMrkNetworkVlans and retrieve all the vlans for that specific network.

maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet will retrieve all Site To Site VPN configurations on a network
This cmdlet will return an object containing all data regarding Site To Site configuration for a specific network

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will retrieve the Site To Site configurations for the Network $id

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet for configuring a single port on a MX appliance
This cmdlet will configure a single port on a MX appliance as either an Accsess port or a Trunk port.
Enter the port number of the port you want to configure
Enter a Type: trunk or access
A comma seperated string with the vlans or type all to allow all vlans
Enter the port number of the port you want to configure
Enter a Type: trunk or access
A comma seperated string with the vlans or type all to allow all vlans

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will configure port 5 as an access port and set it to VLAN 30
This example will configure port 5 as a trunk and set the native vlan to be 1 and allow the vlans: 10,20,30,400,555 to be tagged on the trunk.

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet for connecting to Meraki Dashboard API.
Cmdlet whitch which will authenticate your API key with Meraki Dashboard The cmdlet is necessary for not having to provide the API Key for the follwing cmdlets you will use.

ApiKey for Meraki Dashboard. Check following Meraki Docs to see how to get a Dashboard API Key: https://documentation.meraki.com/General_Administration/Other_Topics/Cisco_Meraki_Dashboard_API#:~:text=For%20access%20to%20the%20API,to%20generate%20an%20API%20key.

Organisation Id for the specific Organisation you want to connect to. If you only have a single organisation, you can skip this parameter. If you have multiple Organisations but don't provide an organisation id the cmdlet will automatically connect you to the first organisation it retrieves.

ApiKey for Meraki Dashboard. Check following Meraki Docs to see how to get a Dashboard API Key: https://documentation.meraki.com/General_Administration/Other_Topics/Cisco_Meraki_Dashboard_API#:~:text=For%20access%20to%20the%20API,to%20generate%20an%20API%20key.

Organisation Id for the specific Organisation you want to connect to. If you only have a single organisation, you can skip this parameter. If you have multiple Organisations but don't provide an organisation id the cmdlet will automatically connect you to the first organisation it retrieves.

dev:type.maml:name: System.String[] - You can pipe the ApiKey as a string into the cmdlet
System.String[] - The cmdlet returns a string with successfull statement, if connection was successfull

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will connect to the Meraki Dashboard API. If you have multiple Organisations attached to your API key, the cmdlet will atumatically connect you to the firs Organisation.
This examplel will connect you to the Merakii Dashboard API, and to the specific organisation specified with the parameter OrgId

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet for setting the Management Interface on Meraki Devices
This cmdlet can be used for setting the Manamgenet Interface on a specified Meraki Device. You can chose to set the interface as DHCP or by setting a static Ip address.
Set the Ip address of the interface
Set the subnet mask of the interface
Set the default gateway for the interface
Set the Ip address of the interface
Set the subnet mask of the interface
Set the default gateway for the interface

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $InterfaceArgs = @{ Serial = $serial Interface = "wan1" ManagementVlan = "20" StaticIpAddress = "192.168.1.2" SubnetMask = "255.255.255.0" DefaultGateway = "192.168.1.1" DNSServers = @( "8.8.8.8", "8.8.4.4" ) }

dev:remarks.maml:para: PS C:\> Set-SCMrkDeviceMgtInterface -UseStaticIP @InterfaceArgs

This example will use splatting to configure the management interface on the device defined by the serial number $serial. The example will configure the interface to use a Static IP address defined by the switch parameter: -UseStaticIP. It will then use the information passed in the splat to configure the interface.
This example will configure the management interface on the device defined by the $serial variable. It will configure the device to use DHCP for configuring the interface.

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet for setting a firewalled service on a specified network
This cmdlet will configure a firewalled service on a network. You can configure the services: web, SNMP and ICMP. You can configure the service to be either: blocked, restricted or unrestricted.
Can be either: ICMP, web or SNMP
Can be either: blocked, restricted, unrestricted
Can be either: ICMP, web or SNMP
Can be either: blocked, restricted, unrestricted

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will set the service SNMP on the network $Id to be restricted and only the IPs 10.245.0.23 and 10.232.45.90 Will have access to that service.
This example will set the service web to be blocked for the network
This will set the service ICMP to be allowed by any remote IP addresses over the internet

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet for adding a new L3 firewall rule to a network
This cmdlet will query all the existing L3 firewall rules and add a new rule to the list. You can chose to place the rule either on top or in the bottom of the list.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $SplatArgs = @{ Comment = "TEST - Allow snmp" Policy = "allow" Protocol = "udp" SourcePort = "161" SourceAddress = "any" DestinationPort = "161" DestinationAddress = "192.168.137.1" PlaceOnTop = $true } Set-SCMrkL3FirewallRule -Id $id @SplatArgs -Verbose

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will create a new firewall named "TEST - Allow snmp" In this example the rule is beeing passed to the cmdlet with splatting. You can also run the cmdlet in the conventional way. In this specific example the new rule will be placed in the top of all the rules. To specify that the rule should be placed in the bottom you can define -PlaceOnTop as $false or not define it at all.

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet for setting SNMP configurations on a specific Meraki Network.

Cmdlet for setting SNMP configurations on a specfic Meraki Network. This cmdlet can be used for setting either Version 1/2c or 3 on a Meraki Network. You will still need to configure access in the L3 firewall besides setting this configuration.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will configure SNMP V1/2c for the network L_918231134598135. It will set the Community String: Password1

This example will configure SNMP V3 for the network L_918231134598135. It will set a user with Username: User1 and Password: Password1. If there are already a user configured it will just add the user to the list.
This example will disable SNMP on the network. All SNMP configurations such as users for Version 3 will be erased.

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet for configuring Site To Site on a network
Cmdlet which lets you configure Site To Site as either Spoke or Hub, or disable Site To Site completely.
If a network is configured as a Spoke and you just want to set a subnet to be available on the VPN you should just run the command as configuring a spoke with that specific subnet
Can be none, spoke or hub
Can be none, spoke or hub

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will configure the Site To Site as a spoke connecting to the Hub: L_6711231278931634675 and Configuring the local subnet 192.168.2.0/24 to be allowed on the VPN.
This example will configure the Site To Site as a Hub

maml:description.maml:para: Enter descriptive name of the port
Enter descriptive name of the port
Enter descriptive name of the port

command:example.dev:code: <example usage> Explanation of what the example does
